title: Support tools like fdisk and dd to directly accss physical and virtual drives
body: Please add support tools like fdisk and dd to directly accss physical and virtual drives. Right now, running `fdisk -l` outputs "cannot open /proc/partitions" and doing something like `dd if=G: of=disk.img` outputs "dd: failed to open ‘G:’: No such file or directory". I do not see anything in /dev/ that seems to indicate anything is mapped to drives in Windows.

comments.body:
I would like to mount a native linux disk attached to my computer,
That is why fdisk/mount is important to me.
Only one OS personality (WSL is one) can be allowed to access the disk directly at a time due to security constraints. Otherwise OS may serve inconsistent state.

I would very much love this! Coupled with actual mount capabilities (linux filesystems), this could be used as a quick access to another partition's linux installation. I don't think it'll ever be possible to leave dual-boot, but at least this way I'd do quick tasks without leaving windows and without spending 2x the needed space for linux
